intro: Platostoma thymifolium, commonly known as the thyme-leaved tansy, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its foliage has a strong, pungent scent reminiscent of thyme, contributing to its common name. Platostoma thymifolium is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
